author:
Jeff Faraudo

jfaraudo@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Matchup: No. 20 Cal at UCLA
text:
NO. 20 CAL AT UCLA RECORDS: Cal 5-1, 2-1 in Pac-12. UCLA 4-2, 1-2. 
KICKOFF: 6 p.m. Thursday at the Rose Bowl, Pasadena. 
TV/RADIO: ESPN/810-AM 
SERIES HISTORY: UCLA leads 52-32-1. The Bruins have won the past two meetings, including 36-34 in Berkeley last season. Cal's most recent win in Pasadena was 45-26 in 2009. 
STORYLINES: Playing for the first time since its 30-24 loss to unbeaten Utah on Oct. 10, Cal needs one more victory to become bowl eligible for the first time since 2011. ... The Bears are 0-8 the past two seasons against the foursome of UCLA, USC, Oregon and Stanford, who are among their next five opponents. ... UCLA held off Cal a year ago when Marcus Rios intercepted Jared Goff's pass at the 2-yard line with 51 seconds left. ... One-time Cal signee Takkarist McKinley of Kennedy-Richmond starts on the Bruins' defensive line. 
INJURY UPDATE: Cal -- WR Jack Austin (foot) is doubtful. RB Daniel Lasco (hip) and OT Brian Farley (ankle) are questionable. DT Mustafa Jalil (knee) is probable. UCLA -- LB Myles Jack (knee), DT Eddie Vanderdoes (knee), DB Fabian Moreau (foot) and S Mossi Johnson (knee) are out. OT Conor McDermott (knee) is doubtful. RB Nate Starks (head) and LB Deon Hollins (knee) are questionable. OG Alex Redmond (hand) is probable. 
MATCHUP TO WATCH: Cal's run game vs. UCLA's run defense. After averaging nearly 210 rushing yards in nonconference play, the Bears have managed only 115 per game in three Pac-12 games. The Bears have missed production from Lasco, limited to 11 carries the past four games because of a hip injury. UCLA allowed its three Pac-12 foes to rush for an average of 285 yards and 5.6 yards per attempt, victimized in particular by Arizona and Stanford -- two of the conference's top running teams. Advertisement 
STATS THAT MATTER: Despite their six turnovers in the loss at Utah, the Bears are No. 2 in the conference in turnover margin at plus-5, thanks to 12 interceptions. ... UCLA allowed only 42 points in three nonconference victories, but has given up 124 points in three Pac-12 games. ... Cal senior WR Bryce Treggs has 168 career receptions to rank No. 5 in school history -- one catch ahead of his father, Brian, who is entering the Cal Athletic Hall of Fame next week. ... UCLA senior running back Paul Perkins has nine career 100-yard rushing games, including three this season. -- JEFF FARAUDO
